{"step_by_step_thinking": "Regional Odontodysplasia, also known as Ghost Teeth, is a rare developmental disorder affecting dental tissues. It can affect both deciduous and permanent dentition. The condition is more common in the maxillary teeth than the mandibular teeth, and it often affects the incisors and canines. Therefore, among the given options, the maxillary central incisor is the most likely to be affected.", "answer_choice": "D. Maxillary central incisor"}
